item.title: PPG 工业公司第四季度利润不及预期
item.description: 由于工业和建筑涂料产品需求下降以及价格疲软，PPG 工业公司周四未能达到华尔街对其第四季度利润的预期。【原文：PPG Industries missed Wall Street's fourth-quarter profit expectations on Thursday, due to lower demand for its industrial and architectural coatings products and weak prices.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚阿尔戈斯集团 2024 年利润增长两倍多
item.description: 哥伦比亚阿尔戈斯集团（Grupo Argos）周四在一份声明中宣布，该集团 2024 年的净利润增长了 221%，达到 2.53 万亿比索（约合 6.09 亿美元）。【原文：Colombia's Grupo Argos reported a 221% increase in net profit in 2024 to 2.53 trillion pesos ($609 million), the conglomerate announced in a statement on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普重申关税威胁，墨西哥比索下跌 1
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普重申威胁要对墨西哥和加拿大这两个最大的贸易伙伴征收 25% 的关税之后，墨西哥比索兑美元汇率在周四的一个波动交易时段下跌了 1%。【原文：The Mexican peso fell 1% against the dollar in a volatile session on Thursday after U.S. President Donald Trump reiterated his threat to impose 25% tariffs on Mexico and Canada, two of its top trade partners.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局称信息技术问题导致边疆航空公司航班短暂停飞
item.description: 根据美国联邦航空管理局发布的公告，边疆航空公司（Frontier Airlines）的信息技术问题导致该公司所有目的地在周四晚间短暂停飞。【原文：IT issues at Frontier Airlines triggered a brief ground stop at all of the U.S. budget carrier's destinations on Thursday evening, according to an advisory from the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration.】

item.title: 特朗普关税不确定性推动避险黄金创新高
item.description: 地缘政治的不确定性和美国总统唐纳德-特朗普关税计划引发的对全球经济增长的担忧所导致的避险需求将金价推向了历史新高，再次将3000美元的关键门槛推向了投资者的视线。【原文：Safe-haven demand due to geopolitical uncertainties and concerns over global economic growth amid U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff plans have hoisted gold prices to a record high, once again bringing the key $3,000 threshold onto investors' radar.】

item.title: 资源匮乏的日本正准备迎接人工智能能源的激增。DeepSeek 提高了赌注。
item.description: 在日本披露了一项具有里程碑意义的能源计划的细节（该计划的部分目的是应对预期的人工智能激增）几周后，中国初创公司 DeepSeek 的崛起颠覆了人们对该行业未来电力需求的传统看法。【原文：Weeks after Japan revealed details of a landmark energy plan partly designed to keep up with an expected AI surge, the shock rise of Chinese startup DeepSeek has upended conventional wisdom over the sector's future power demands.】

item.title: 尽管壳牌注销，大西洋海岸仍重申对新泽西州海上风电的承诺
item.description: 本周四，壳牌公司（Shell Plc）和法国电力公司（EDF）的合资企业大西洋海岸公司（Atlantic Shores）重申了其交付新泽西州首个海上风电项目的承诺，尽管壳牌公司最近对该合资企业进行了 10 亿美元的注销。【原文：Atlantic Shores, a joint venture between Shell Plc and France's EDF, reiterated its commitment to delivering New Jersey's first offshore wind project on Thursday, despite Shell's recent $1 billion write-off related to the venture.】

item.title: 新日铁交易受阻，美国钢铁公司季度业绩低迷
item.description: 美国钢铁公司（U.S. Steel）周四公布的第四季度财报显示，受价格下跌和需求环境不稳定的影响，该公司第四季度的亏损和收入均低于华尔街的预期。【原文：U.S. Steel reported fourth-quarter loss and revenue that matched Wall Street estimates on Thursday, dented by price declines and a bumpy demand environment.】

item.title: 沃尔格林在扭亏为盈之际暂停派发季度股息
item.description: 美国连锁药店运营商沃尔格林博姿联盟（Walgreens Boots Alliance）周四表示，该公司已暂停发放季度现金股息，以配合重组工作。【原文：Walgreens Boots Alliance has suspended its quarterly cash dividend amid restructuring efforts, the U.S. pharmacy chain operator said on Thursday.】

item.title: 贝克休斯因油田技术需求而实现超预期季度利润
item.description: 美国油田技术公司贝克休斯（Baker Hughes）周四公布的第四季度利润超出华尔街预期，主要得益于对其工业和技术产品的需求。【原文：U.S. oilfield technology firm Baker Hughes beat Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter profit on Thursday, helped by demand for its industrial and technology products.】

item.title: 美国散户投资者因 DeepSeek 大跌跳水科技股
item.description: Vanda Research 公司周三发布的数据显示，本周早些时候，市场因对一家中国人工智能初创公司的担忧而大跌，个人投资者纷纷买入各种科技股，以应对市场的下跌。【原文：Individual investors responded to the market selloff earlier this week triggered by concerns regarding a Chinese artificial intelligence startup by buying a wide array of technology stocks, according to data released by Vanda Research on Wednesday.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，亚马逊加大对埃隆-马斯克 X 的广告投入
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四援引知情人士的话报道，亚马逊公司正在增加在亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克的社交媒体平台 X 上的广告投放。【原文：Amazon.com is increasing its advertising on billionaire Elon Musk's social media platform X, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Arthur J Gallagher 因佣金增长而在第四季度实现盈利
item.description: Arthur J Gallagher 公司周四公布第四季度盈利，而去年同期为亏损，原因是保险活动的增加提高了经纪服务的费用和佣金。【原文：Arthur J Gallagher on Thursday posted a profit for the fourth quarter, compared with a loss a year earlier, as heightened insurance activity boosted fees and commissions from its brokerage services.】

item.title: 早间竞价特朗普关税手榴弹威胁市场平静
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: Northvolt 北美分部首席执行官卸任
item.description: 瑞典电动汽车电池制造商 Northvolt 联合创始人保罗-切鲁蒂（Paolo Cerruti）周四表示，他将辞去 Northvolt 北美分部首席执行官的职务。【原文：Northvolt's co-founder Paolo Cerruti will step down from his role as chief executive officer of its North American division, the Swedish electric-vehicle battery maker said on Thursday.】

item.title: 即使 iPhone 和中国市场销量不尽如人意，苹果公司利润仍超过华尔街目标
item.description: 周四，苹果公司的季度利润超过了华尔街的预期，但由于中国市场的激烈竞争和人工智能功能的缓慢推出，假日季度的 iPhone 销售和中国市场收入疲软。【原文：Apple beat Wall Street's quarterly profit estimates on Thursday, but iPhone sales and China revenue for the holiday quarter were weak due to stiff Chinese competition and a slow rollout of artificial intelligence features.】

item.title: 霍卡母公司德克斯户外用品公司（Deckers Outdoor）尽管假日季度业绩稳健，但预期令人失望
item.description: 德克斯户外用品公司（Deckers Outdoor）周四公布的第三季度销售额超出预期，原因是该公司生产的霍卡（Hoka）跑鞋在假日期间需求强劲。【原文：Deckers Outdoor on Thursday beat third-quarter sales estimates on robust holiday demand for its Hoka running shoes, but an in-line annual forecast caused the footwear maker's shares to tumble 17% in extended trading.】

item.title: 假期消费强劲，Visa 利润大增
item.description: 周四，Visa 公布第一季度利润增长，原因是这家全球最大的支付处理商的客户在节假日期间在从旅游到外出就餐等各个方面大肆挥霍。【原文：Visa reported a higher first-quarter profit on Thursday as the world's largest payment processor's customers splurged on everything from travel to dining out during the holiday season.】

item.title: 英特尔营收预期令人失望，投资者等待新任首席执行官上任
item.description: 英特尔公司周四公布的第一季度营收预期不及分析师预期，该芯片制造商正努力应对传统数据中心芯片需求不振和关键个人电脑市场份额下降的问题。【原文：Intel's first-quarter revenue forecast on Thursday missed analyst estimates, as the chipmaker grapples with tepid demand for traditional data center chips and declining share in the key personal computer market.】

item.title: 特朗普称美国将对墨西哥和加拿大商品征收 25% 的关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周四表示，美国将对从墨西哥和加拿大进口的商品征收25%的关税，重申了他对这两个美国主要贸易伙伴国的警告。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday said the United States will put a 25% tariff on imports from Mexico and Canada, repeating his warning to the two countries which are top U.S. trade partners.】

item.title: 波音公司撤换 "星际客机 "飞船部门主管
item.description: 波音公司发言人周四告诉路透社，领导波音公司 "星际客机 "航天器部门的副总裁马克-纳皮（Mark Nappi）已经离开了这个陷入困境的项目，接替他的是该公司国际空间站项目经理约翰-穆赫兰（John Mulholland）。【原文：The vice president leading Boeing's Starliner spacecraft unit, Mark Nappi, has left the troubled program and was replaced by the company's International Space Station program manager, John Mulholland, a Boeing spokesperson told Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 立法者敦促特朗普考虑对中国深鉴科技使用的英伟达芯片实施新的限制措施
item.description: 两名美国国会议员呼吁唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府考虑限制英伟达公司生产的人工智能芯片的出口，称中国人工智能公司 DeepSeek 依赖这些芯片。【原文：Two U.S. Congress members are calling on President Donald Trump's administration to consider restricting the export of artificial intelligence chips made by Nvidia, alleging Chinese AI firm DeepSeek has relied on them.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，星巴克与工会同意引入调解员进行合同谈判
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周四报道，星巴克及其代表 10,000 多名咖啡师的工会已同意引入一名外部调解员，以帮助恢复中断的谈判。【原文：Starbucks and its union representing more than 10,000 baristas have agreed to bring in an outside mediator to help resume halted bargaining talks, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：OpenAI 正在洽谈一轮投资，估值高达 3400 亿美元
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四报道，OpenAI 正在洽谈一轮投资，该轮投资将使这家人工智能初创公司的估值高达 3400 亿美元。【原文：OpenAI is in talks for an investment round that would value the AI startup at up to $340 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 意大利隐私监管机构封杀中国人工智能应用 DeepSeek
item.description: 意大利数据保护机构周四表示，由于缺乏关于中国人工智能模型 DeepSeek 使用个人数据的信息，该机构已经封杀了 DeepSeek。【原文：Italy's data protection authority said on Thursday it had blocked Chinese artificial intelligence model DeepSeek over a lack of information on its use of personal data.】

item.title: 消息人士透露，Blackstone 正在洽谈购买纽约办公楼的股份
item.description: 两位熟悉此事的消息人士周四透露，Blackstone 正在与摩根大通资产管理公司（JPMorgan Asset Management）的机构投资者洽谈购买纽约一栋 50 层办公楼的大量股份。【原文：Blackstone is in talks to buy a sizeable stake in a New York 50-story office building from institutional investors of JPMorgan Asset Management, two sources familiar with the matter said on Thursday.】

item.title: 尽管 DeepSeek 动荡不安，Blackstone 仍坚持数据中心投资
item.description: 黑石集团（Blackstone）周四表示，其在数据中心的大规模投资不会因中国 DeepSeek 的低成本人工智能模型而受到影响，因为对实体基础设施的需求对人工智能仍然至关重要。【原文：Blackstone said on Thursday its massive investments in data centers would not be undermined by the low-cost artificial intelligence models from China's DeepSeek, as the need for physical infrastructure was still vital for AI.】

item.title: 首席执行官称，瑞银资本要求的提高将增加其他银行的成本
item.description: 瑞士银行首席执行官塞尔吉奥-埃尔莫蒂（Sergio Ermotti）周四表示，作为一家系统性相关银行，对瑞银施加更高的资本要求将使企业和家庭承担更高的成本。【原文：Imposing higher capital requirements on UBS as a systemically relevant bank will usher in higher costs for companies and households, the Swiss lender's CEO, Sergio Ermotti, said on Thursday.】

item.title: Netspend 在纽约和解协议中赔偿多收的客户费用
item.description: 可充值借记卡和工资卡供应商 Netspend 将支付约 110 万美元，以了结纽约州对其非法向低收入客户收取高额预支工资利息并让讨债公司扣押其资金的指控。【原文：Netspend, a provider of reloadable debit cards and payroll cards, will pay about $1.1 million to settle New York state accusations it illegally charged low-income customers exorbitant interest rates on paycheck advances, and let debt collectors seize their funds.】

item.title: 首席执行官表示，H&M 必须提高标准以应对激烈的快速时尚竞争
item.description: H&M 公司首席执行官丹尼尔-埃尔弗（Daniel Erver）告诉路透社记者，H&M 公司不能仅靠价格取胜，必须在竞争激烈的快速时尚行业中使自己的服装更时尚、质量更高。【原文：H&M cannot win on price alone and must make its clothes more trendy and of higher-quality in the fiercely competitive fast-fashion sector, its CEO Daniel Erver told Reuters.】
